definitions: inspiring confidence, hope, or motivation to continue or improve something
supporting or promoting development, growth, or advancement in various contexts
examples: The encouraging test results motivated students to study harder
Her encouraging words helped him overcome his doubts
The encouraging economic indicators suggest steady growth ahead
Scientists found encouraging signs of recovery in the ecosystem

definitions: gradually advancing beyond usual or proper limits into another's territory or space
improperly exceeding boundaries of authority, rights, or established norms
examples: The encroaching floodwaters threatened nearby homes and businesses
Desert sands are encroaching on formerly fertile farmland
Government surveillance represents an encroaching threat to privacy
The encroaching demands of work affected his family life

definitions: covered with a hard layer or coating formed by dried or hardened material
decorated or covered thickly with precious stones, jewels, or ornamental materials
examples: The ancient artifact was encrusted with centuries of dirt
Barnacles encrusted the bottom of the old ship's hull
The queen's crown was encrusted with diamonds and rubies
An encrusted gold bracelet sparkled in the display case

definitions: weighed down or hindered by carrying heavy or awkward physical burdens
restricted or hampered by debts, legal obligations, or other limiting factors
examples: The hikers were encumbered by heavy backpacks and equipment
Encumbered with shopping bags, she struggled to open the door
The property is encumbered by multiple liens and mortgages
His career was encumbered by past mistakes and controversies

definitions: containing or providing comprehensive and detailed information on many subjects or aspects
characteristic of or relating to the format, style, or content of encyclopedias
examples: His encyclopedic knowledge of baseball statistics impressed everyone
The book provides an encyclopedic overview of world history
The encyclopedic entry covered all aspects of the topic
She wrote in an encyclopedic style with extensive references

definitions: at serious risk of extinction as a species due to environmental or human factors
put at risk of harm, damage, or loss in any context
examples: The endangered species list includes several whale populations
Habitat loss has made these birds critically endangered
His reckless driving endangered everyone on the highway
The scandal endangered her political career significantly

definitions: causing others to feel affection, warmth, or fondness through charm or appeal
examples: Her endearing smile made everyone feel welcome immediately
The puppy's endearing behavior won over the entire family
His endearing habit of bringing flowers made her happy
The child's endearing mispronunciations amused the adults greatly

definitions: brought to a conclusion, finish, or termination of an activity or state
characterized by a particular type or manner of conclusion or termination
examples: The ended relationship left both parties feeling relieved
After the ended meeting, everyone returned to their offices
The open-ended question allowed for multiple interpretations
A never-ended cycle of poverty affected the region

definitions: naturally occurring in and restricted to a particular geographical area or region
regularly found among particular people or in a certain area as a persistent problem
examples: Endemic species in Madagascar include many unique lemur varieties
This plant is endemic to the Hawaiian island chain
Corruption seems endemic to the political system there unfortunately
Endemic poverty affects several regions of the country persistently

definitions: having no end or limit in space, extent, or size; infinite in scope
continuing for such a long time as to seem without end; interminable
examples: The endless ocean stretched to the horizon magnificently
Scientists ponder the endless expanse of the universe
The endless meetings drained everyone's energy and enthusiasm
Children asked endless questions during the museum tour

definitions: relating to glands that secrete hormones directly into the bloodstream to regulate body functions
examples: The endocrine system regulates metabolism and growth processes
Diabetes involves dysfunction of endocrine pancreatic cells specifically
An endocrine specialist diagnosed her thyroid condition accurately
Endocrine disruptors in plastics concern many health experts

definitions: having an internal cause or origin; growing or produced from within an organism or system
examples: Endogenous depression arises from internal biochemical imbalances primarily
The body produces endogenous opioids to manage pain naturally
Endogenous economic growth comes from internal market forces
Researchers studied endogenous variables in the experimental model

definitions: naturally provided with a particular quality, ability, or physical attribute
provided with a permanent fund or source of income, especially for an institution
examples: She was endowed with exceptional musical talent naturally
The region is richly endowed with natural resources
The endowed chair position attracts distinguished professors worldwide
An endowed scholarship fund helps deserving students annually

definitions: continuing or lasting for a long time; having permanent value or significance
bearing or withstanding hardship, pain, or difficult circumstances with patience
examples: Their enduring friendship survived decades of separation successfully
The novel's enduring appeal attracts new readers constantly
After enduring years of hardship, they finally found success
The enduring patients waited hours for medical attention

definitions: showing or involving great activity, vitality, or force; full of energy
requiring or involving the expenditure of considerable energy or effort
examples: The energetic children played outside all afternoon enthusiastically
Her energetic personality brightened every room she entered
The energetic workout left everyone exhausted but satisfied
Dancing salsa is an energetic activity requiring stamina

definitions: capable of being enforced or compelled, especially through legal means or authority
examples: The contract contains several enforceable provisions regarding payment
Not all promises are legally enforceable in court
Company policies must be clear and enforceable consistently
The new regulations are immediately enforceable nationwide today

definitions: compelled to be obeyed or observed through the use of authority or power
made obligatory or mandatory through official action or decree
examples: Strictly enforced speed limits reduced accidents significantly here
The enforced curfew kept teenagers off streets at night
Enforced military service affects all eligible citizens equally
The enforced dress code sparked student protests yesterday

definitions: given the right to vote in political elections or participate in democratic processes
examples: Newly enfranchised citizens eagerly participated in elections yesterday
The enfranchised population doubled after the constitutional amendment
Previously disenfranchised groups became enfranchised through civil rights legislation
Enfranchised shareholders voted on the merger proposal today

definitions: actively involved in or committed to an activity, cause, or situation
having formally agreed to marry someone; betrothed to be married
busy or occupied with a particular activity or unavailable for other tasks
examples: Engaged students participate more actively in classroom discussions
She remained engaged in community service throughout her life
The engaged couple planned their wedding for next summer
They became engaged after dating for three years
The phone line was engaged for over an hour
All staff members are currently engaged with other customers

definitions: charming and attractive; able to draw and hold attention or interest pleasantly
examples: Her engaging personality made her popular with clients
The professor's engaging lectures filled the auditorium daily
The book offers an engaging narrative about historical events
Children found the engaging activities both fun and educational

definitions: cut or carved into a hard surface to form letters, designs, or patterns
firmly fixed or deeply impressed in memory, mind, or consciousness
examples: The engraved inscription on the monument honored fallen soldiers
Her name was beautifully engraved on the silver bracelet
The traumatic event remained engraved in his memory forever
Those words became engraved in her heart permanently

definitions: having all one's attention or interest absorbed by someone or something completely
examples: She was so engrossed in her book she missed her stop
The children sat engrossed in the magician's performance
Engrossed in conversation, they didn't notice the time passing
He became engrossed in solving the complex puzzle

definitions: absorbing all one's attention or interest; completely engaging and fascinating
examples: The engrossing mystery novel kept readers awake all night
She found the documentary engrossing and highly informative
His engrossing presentation captivated the entire audience completely
The engrossing gameplay made hours pass like minutes

definitions: improved in quality, value, or effectiveness through additions or modifications
intensified, increased, or augmented in degree, amount, or strength
examples: The enhanced version includes better graphics and sound
Enhanced security measures protect sensitive data more effectively
The drug's enhanced effects lasted longer than expected
Enhanced interrogation techniques remain highly controversial topics

definitions: difficult to interpret or understand; mysterious, puzzling, or ambiguous in nature
examples: Her enigmatic smile left everyone wondering her true thoughts
The artist's enigmatic paintings invite multiple interpretations
The enigmatic message contained several hidden meanings apparently
He maintained an enigmatic silence throughout the investigation

definitions: giving delight or pleasure; providing satisfaction or pleasant experiences
examples: The enjoyable evening included good food and great company
Swimming in the ocean is an enjoyable summer activity
We had an enjoyable conversation about shared interests yesterday
The book was enjoyable despite its serious subject matter

definitions: made larger in physical size, volume, or dimensions than before
expanded in scope, extent, or comprehensiveness beyond original limits
examples: The enlarged photograph revealed previously hidden details clearly
Doctors discovered an enlarged heart during the examination
The enlarged edition includes three new chapters entirely
Their enlarged responsibilities included managing international operations

definitions: having or showing rational, modern, and well-informed outlook free from prejudice
having achieved spiritual knowledge or insight, especially in Buddhism or similar traditions
examples: The enlightened policy promoted equality and social justice
Enlightened leaders consider diverse perspectives before deciding
The enlightened master taught meditation to eager students
After years of practice, she reached an enlightened state

definitions: giving spiritual or intellectual insight; providing useful information or understanding
examples: The enlightening documentary changed viewers' perspectives completely
Her enlightening comments clarified the complex issue perfectly
The enlightening discussion revealed new aspects of the problem
Reading philosophy can be an enlightening experience overall

definitions: made more lively, interesting, or cheerful; given greater vitality or spirit
examples: Music enlivened the otherwise dull party considerably tonight
Her enlivened expression showed genuine excitement and joy
The enlivened debate engaged all participants actively throughout
Colorful decorations enlivened the dreary office space beautifully

definitions: very large in size, quantity, extent, or degree; immense or huge
examples: An enormous whale surfaced near our boat yesterday
The project required enormous amounts of time and resources
She felt enormous pressure to succeed in her role
The discovery had enormous implications for medical science

definitions: very angry; filled with or showing extreme anger or fury
examples: The enraged customer demanded to speak with the manager
Enraged protesters stormed the government building yesterday
She became enraged when she discovered the betrayal
His enraged response shocked everyone in the room

definitions: coming immediately after something in time, order, or as a consequence
examples: The ensuing chaos lasted for several hours afterward
In the ensuing years, technology advanced rapidly worldwide
The ensuing discussion clarified many important points effectively
Legal battles continued throughout the ensuing decade persistently

definitions: twisted together or caught in a tangle of objects, threads, or materials
involved in a complicated or compromising relationship or situation
examples: The fishing net became entangled in underwater debris
Her long hair was entangled in the thorny bushes
He became entangled in a web of lies and deceit
The company was entangled in multiple legal disputes

definitions: showing initiative, resourcefulness, and willingness to undertake new projects or ventures
examples: The enterprising student started a successful online business
Enterprising entrepreneurs transformed the abandoned warehouse district
Her enterprising approach to problem-solving impressed management greatly
Enterprising farmers found new markets for organic produce

definitions: provided with amusement, enjoyment, or engaging diversion for pleasure
considered or given thought to an idea, possibility, or suggestion
examples: The entertained audience applauded enthusiastically after the show
Children remained entertained throughout the lengthy car journey
She entertained doubts about the project's feasibility initially
The committee entertained several proposals before deciding finally

definitions: providing amusement, enjoyment, or pleasure; interesting and engaging to watch or experience
examples: The entertaining show kept audiences laughing throughout the evening
She's an entertaining speaker who combines humor with insight
The book offers an entertaining look at historical events
Entertaining guests requires planning and attention to detail

definitions: captured and held the complete attention and fascination of someone
examples: The enthralled audience watched the acrobats perform breathlessly
Children sat enthralled by the storyteller's animated performance
She was enthralled by the beauty of the landscape
Readers remained enthralled until the very last page

definitions: capturing and holding complete attention through being extremely interesting or charming
examples: The enthralling performance earned a standing ovation immediately
Her enthralling stories of adventure captivated young listeners
The documentary provided an enthralling look at ocean life
The enthralling mystery kept readers guessing until the end

definitions: having or showing intense and eager enjoyment, interest, or approval
examples: The enthusiastic crowd cheered wildly for their team
She gave an enthusiastic endorsement of the new policy
Enthusiastic volunteers worked tirelessly throughout the weekend event
His enthusiastic response exceeded everyone's expectations completely

definitions: attractive and tempting; arousing desire or interest through being appealing
examples: The enticing aroma of fresh bread filled the bakery
Travel brochures featured enticing pictures of tropical beaches
The company made an enticing offer to recruit top talent
Enticing discounts attracted many customers to the sale

definitions: constituting the full amount, extent, or duration; complete and not lacking any part
examples: The entire building was evacuated during the fire alarm
She spent her entire savings on the new car
The entire process takes approximately three weeks to complete
His entire family attended the graduation ceremony yesterday

definitions: having a right to something; qualified for by right according to law
given a title or name to a work, book, or other creation
believing oneself to be inherently deserving of privileges or special treatment
examples: Employees are entitled to four weeks of vacation annually
Citizens are entitled to vote in democratic elections
The book entitled 'Silent Spring' changed environmental awareness
Her presentation was entitled 'Future of Technology'
His entitled attitude annoyed his hardworking colleagues greatly
The entitled customer demanded special treatment immediately

definitions: filled with wonder and delight; held spellbound as if in a trance
examples: The entranced children watched the magician perform miracles
She stood entranced by the beautiful sunset view
Entranced listeners forgot everything else during the concert
He seemed entranced by her graceful dancing movements

definitions: firmly established and difficult to change; deeply rooted in tradition or practice
positioned in trenches or fortified positions for military defense
examples: Entrenched attitudes about gender roles are slowly changing
Corruption became entrenched in the political system unfortunately
The entrenched soldiers defended their position for days
Enemy forces were entrenched along the mountain ridge

definitions: characterized by initiative, willingness to undertake new ventures, and ability to organize business
examples: Her entrepreneurial spirit led to three successful startups
The city fosters an entrepreneurial culture among residents
Entrepreneurial skills are increasingly valued in corporate settings
His entrepreneurial approach transformed the struggling department completely

definitions: completely enclosing or surrounding something; wrapping or covering entirely on all sides
examples: The enveloping darkness made navigation extremely difficult outside
An enveloping sense of peace filled the meditation room
Enveloping fog reduced visibility to just a few meters
The enveloping warmth of the blanket comforted the child

definitions: arousing envy; highly desirable and worthy of being envied by others
examples: She has an enviable collection of rare books
His enviable position offers excellent benefits and flexibility
The company achieved an enviable safety record last year
They live in an enviable location near the beach

definitions: feeling or showing envy; resentfully aware of another's advantages or possessions
examples: She felt envious of her sister's academic success
Envious neighbors gossiped about their lottery winnings constantly
His envious glances revealed his true feelings clearly
Don't be envious of what others have achieved

definitions: relating to the natural world and human impact on its condition
relating to the surroundings or conditions in which something exists or operates
examples: Environmental protection laws regulate industrial emissions strictly
The environmental impact assessment revealed significant concerns
Environmental factors influence children's development significantly overall
The office's environmental conditions affect employee productivity
